newsitem.title: UK: LVMH chairman spotted in London -sources.
newsitem.headline: LVMH chairman spotted in London -sources.

text.p: Bernard Arnault, the wily chairman of French luxury goods company LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton, visited major shareholders in Guinness Plc and Grand Metropolitan Plc on Monday, said industry sources.

"I saw him this morning and he's been spotted all over the City. Evidently he was planning to leave around lunchtime for Edinburgh," said an industry source who declined to be named. A spokesman acting for LVMH in London declined to comment.
Arnault was not expected in London until Thursday but landed in London in his private Lear jet this morning.
He flew on to meet fund managers at Standard Life and Scottish Widows in Edinburgh this afternoon, said another industry source.

Arnault planned to return on Thursday to London to see more shareholders in an effort to persuade them that his proposal for the break up of Guinness and GrandMet will add more value for shareholders than a straight merger of the two companies, the sources said.
